When I first played this game, I was homeless, divorced, and had a dying will to live. Since playing this game, non of that changed. Good game though.

One thing I don't know why
It doesn't even matter how hard you try
Keep that in mind, I designed this rhyme
To explain in due time
All I know
Time is a valuable thing
Watch it fly by as the pendulum swings
Watch it count down to the end of the day
The clock ticks life away
It's so unreal
Didn't look out below
Watch the time go right out the window
Tryin' to hold on, did-didn't even know
I wasted it all just to watch you go
I kept everything inside and even though I tried
It all fell apart
What it meant to me will eventually
Be a memory of a time when I tried so hard
I tried so hard and got so far
But in the end it doesn't even matter
I had to fall to lose it all
But in the end it doesn't even matter

Apesar da trajetÃ³ria impecÃ¡vel que a Valve fez nos anos 2000, com jogos como Portal, Left4Dead, Dota 2, Counter-Strike: Global Offensive e Team Fortress 2, foi Half-Life, jogo de 1998, que foi o responsÃ¡vel por pavimentar o caminho dourado que estaria por vir. Portanto, Ã© comum pensarmos que um jogo de estreia funcione como uma mera "fundaÃ§Ã£o", uma primeira aventura dos desenvolvedores, que ainda estÃ£o com medo de mergulhar no mar e sÃ³ pÃµe as pontas dos dedos do pÃ©.

Isso Ã© a pior maneira de descrever Half-Life.

O design de nÃ­veis Ã© extraordinÃ¡rio, possibilitando diversas maneiras de vocÃª atravessÃ¡-lo e recompensando a sua exploraÃ§Ã£o com segredos e mais suprimentos para enfrentar invasores de outra dimensÃ£o.

Os inimigos sÃ£o desafiadores (e um pouco frustrantes, mas isso se dÃ¡ por conta da idade do jogo) e variados, forÃ§ando vocÃª a usar o vasto arsenal que conquistarÃ¡ ao longo da sua escapatÃ³ria. 

A histÃ³ria Ã© simples: VocÃª Ã© Gordon Freeman, um fÃ­sico teÃ³rico empregado pela Black Mesa, que Ã© pego em um experimento fracassado que traz seres de outro mundo. Ã‰ uma premissa boa o suficiente para justificar uma campanha de aÃ§Ã£o e FPS, mas os cuidados com o storytelling e a preparaÃ§Ã£o para o final sÃ£o inovadoras para a Ã©poca e uma maneira interessante de engajar o jogador dentro dos limites de um design linear (Me lembrou muito o que foi feito no primeiro Portal. Preste atenÃ§Ã£o ao que estÃ¡ ao seu arredor!).

Apesar de alguns maneirismos da Ã©poca que podem se tornar inconvenientes para o jogador, como a falta de legendas e de feedback na hora do tiroteio (pelo menos, eu achei difÃ­cil saber logo de cara quando um inimigo morreu), Ã© um jogo que vale a pena para qualquer amante de games, nÃ£o sÃ³ pela fundaÃ§Ã£o que ele representa para a histÃ³ria da Valve, um dos maiores estÃºdios de videogame de todos os tempos, como pela prÃ³pria experiÃªncia em si.

[i]My opinion[/i]: You know, this is a good game. 
[i]My journey[/i]: I had a very long journey with HL: approximately 22 years. I bought a license version, played a lot being kid on my father's Win98 machine with 266MHz Pentium II, 8Mb video card, 4Gb HDD, huge square lamp monitor, mouse with a ball instead optics and dial up internet... 
By the way, my grandfather had Win95 with boost button. When it was boosted the speed was 233MHz. My uncle had a machine which was loaded via 5.25 floppy. It had a 3D game where you was driving a tank against other tanks and the graphics was simply a bunch of white geometric lines. 
[i]Proceeding with my journey[/i] : In 00s' my saves became broken two times. Probably it was a problem with HDD but it doesn't matter. Then the disk was stolen (actually not the disk, but the license key. the box was simply replaced or someone thew away the paper with key...), I deleted the game because of small HDD and lived all these years thinking of HL. Finally I bought it 2nd time this Summer 2022 and spend 9 hours playing till the end. I am simply happy : )

It took me 12 hours to pass this frustrating game! I'm never putting myself through that again.

Save, save and freaking save.

yjhv

Monumental title that changed the landscape of gaming as a whole.

Pros: - Great atmosphere and world
         - Responsive controls and relatively good gunplay
         - Interesting story and storytelling techniques
         - The sequel is Half-Life 2

Cons: - Level design, while immersive, can often feel obtuse
          - Hitscanning
          - Checkpoints aren't very good

Generally just things you would expect from a 25 year old game. It's not badly designed by any means, but is held back by modern standards due to technical limitations of the time.

Still holds up surprisingly well though.

6.5/10
